creator: pkrause@soundbite.com
text:
XMLValidate creates and used an empty catalog for these use cases
<xmlvalidate file="struts-config.xml" warn="false">
  <dtd publicId="-//Apache Software Foundation//DTD Struts Configuration 
1.0//EN"
       location="struts-config_1_0.dtd"/>
</xmlvalidate>

<xmlvalidate failonerror="no">
  <fileset dir="${project.dir}" includes="**/*.xml"/>
  <xmlcatalog refid="mycatalog"/>
</xmlvalidate>


This use case still works:
<xmlvalidate failonerror="no">
  <fileset dir="${project.dir}" includes="**/*.xml"/>
  <xmlcatalog>
       <dtd
         publicId="-//ArielPartners//DTD XML Article V1.0//EN"
         location="com/arielpartners/knowledgebase/dtd/article.dtd"/>
  </xmlcatalog>
</xmlvalidate>

Please help me - what is broken and what does work?

Can you provide a test-case?
creator: bodewig@apache.org
pkrause@soundbite.com
text:
Implicit xmlcatalog is broken (first case, above).  The Struts Configuration is 
read from the web, not from the file struts-config_1_0.dtd.

Same problem with referenced xmlcatalog (second case, above).

Explicit inclusion of xmlcatalog and its contents (third case, above) does work.

Craegt K Strong writes:
: Was probably the result of a corrupted patch applied.  Mea culpa.

: The good news, however, is that I believe it should all work now,
: as Stephan has just committed my fixes.  Is there a nightly build
: you can check (tonight or tomorrow?)

I have verified this is fixed in latest CVS
